records.location_details: Dead body found in river Evros, close to the Greek bank, in the area of Petrades, Didymoteicho, Evros, Greece.
records.context_note: On 15-06-2020 at 12:00, one (1) male dead body has been found in river Evros, close to the Greek bank, in the area of Petrades. The dead body was transferred to Alexandroupolis' Hospital. The autopsy was requested by Hellenic Police in order to identify the reason of death. Preliminary investigation is still ongoing by the Security Department of Didymoteicho. The dead body was possibly a migrant from Morocco, who tried to cross the river. 29/07/2020: According to a doctor after an autopsy it is estimated that this man was between 25 and 35 years old and he was drawn in the water, inside a timeframe of three months before the day that he was found. One credit card was found on him. An Arabic name was written on it and the card was from a bank from Morocco.
records.evidence_quote: one (1) male dead body has been found in river Evros, close to the Greek bank, in the area of Petrades

records.location_details: Gun shots heard from the area around village Marasia (area of Turkey) near Kastanies, Evros, Greece.
records.context_note: Gun shots. Text removed - justification 4 reported around 7:00 text removed - justification 4 from morning shift (text removed - justification 4) informed about hearable gunshots from the area around village Marasia (area of Turkey). The sound also was heard by Hellenic Police Officers who passed the info to HP communication center. The shots were far away from Text removed - justification 4 position and no visual contact with shooters was possible. Nobody was injured. Hellenic Police and military monitoring constantly the area.
records.evidence_quote: hearable gunshots from the area around village Marasia (area of Turkey).

records.location_details: Lost weapon during a trip, found at Sofia Airport after a Frontex charter flight arrival from Sofia, related to Alexandroupoli, Evros, Greece deployment.
records.context_note: Lost weapon during the trip. Today after Frontex charter flight arrival from Sofia with the new text removed - justification 2 deployed in frame of RBI 2020 Evros, during handing over the weapons from airport staff to text removed - justification 2, one gun of text removed - justification 2 was missed. Text removed - justification 2 confirmed check-in the weapon at Sofai Airport. Airport personnel checked once again a baggage compartment in the plane and text removed - justification 2 baggage was x-rayed as well. Bulgarian Airport Police is conducting an investigation about this case. The weapon has been handed over to the prosecutor as part of a standard procedure. It appears that the weapon fell off the luggage belt in Sofia Airport, without having been noticed. The weapon most probably will be returned to the Police of Sofia Airport next week. Finally text removed - justification 2 on spot was informed that the weapon was found at Sofia Airport. The company confirmed delivery the weapon to the owner. Text removed - justification 2 got the weapon yesterday and the case is over.
records.evidence_quote: one gun of text removed - justification 2 was missed... the weapon was found at Sofia Airport.

records.location_details: Migrant killed by train in Tychero, Evros, Greece.
records.context_note: On 05-06-2020 at 09.30 hrs one (01) migrant (male) was hit and killed by train running from Alexandroupolis to Ormenio. The driver of the train stopped immediately and informed Hellenic Police after he realized the incident. It is supposed after the investigation that the migrant was probably sleeping on the railways and was killed immediately. An ID card was found in his possession issued by AFG authorities. According to ID the migrant was 25. The corpse of the dead person was transported to Alexandroupolis' Hospital. Forensic surgeon of Alexandroupolis' Hospital was requested to conduct the autopsy. No criminal activity was recognized.
records.evidence_quote: one (01) migrant (male) was hit and killed by train running from Alexandroupolis to Ormenio.

records.location_details: Gunfire shots heard from the area around village Marasia (Turkey) near BCP Kastanies, Evros, Greece.
records.context_note: Shooting cases. On 21.05.2020, text removed - justification 2 deployed in a frame of FOA Land to Orestiada and text removed - justification 2 deployed in a frame of RBI Evros while patrolling in the vicinity of BCP Kastanies, reported that they heard a few possible gunfire shots, coming from Marasia (border village to the north of Kastanies). None of the text removed - justification 2 saw who did it. It was not possible to localize the cases of the shootings by hearing due to the wind. Timeline of the shooting is as follows: At 22:24 12 shots were heard (later local GRC patrol deployed to the north, next to the river, reported that the shots were coming from a TUR patrol in the area); At 22:32 3 shots were heard (later local GRC patrol deployed to the north, next to the river, reported that the shots were coming from a TUR patrol in the area); On 22.05.2020, at 02.25 15 shots were heard (those shots were not reported by local GRC patrols and it was not possible to estimate their origin or location due to the wind). Nobody has been injured. Hellenic Police monitoring the area.
records.evidence_quote: heard a few possible gunfire shots, coming from Marasia (border village to the north of Kastanies).

records.location_details: Dead body found by HP Officers patrolling close to Tychero area, Evros, Greece.
records.context_note: Dead body found. HP Officers of BCU Tychero who were patrolling close to Tychero area found 2 migrants (male and female) and a dead body (male). Those 2 migrants stated that the dead person is their father - SYR national and they had entered the Greek territory illegally from Evros river a few hours ago. The 2 migrants, also SYR nationals (not minors) were apprehended for illegal entry in BCU Tychero. None of them had travel documents. HP in Tychero stand ready to provide with any doctor support when needed. Dead body was transferred to Alexandroupolis' Hospital. The autopsy was requested by Hellenic Police in order to identify the reason of death. According to the official statements of 2 SYR children his father was suffering from heart problems and this could be probably the reason of his death. The authopsy showed heart attack as a reason for the migrant death.
records.evidence_quote: HP Officers of BCU Tychero who were patrolling close to Tychero area found 2 migrants (male and female) and a dead body (male).

records.location_details: Dead body found in the river of Evros, close to the Greek bank, in the area of Mandra, Orestiada, Evros, Greece.
records.context_note: Dead body found. On 14-05-2020 at 11:00, one (1) male dead body (about thirty years old) has been found in the river of Evros, close to the Greek bank, in the area of Mandra Text Removed - Justification 4. The dead body has been transferred to Alexandroupolis' Hospital. The autopsy was requested by Hellenic Police in order to identify the reason of death. Investigation has been undertaken by the Security Department of Didimotiko. It is likely to be a migrant who tried to cross the border. The authopsy showed no criminal activity caused the migrant death.
records.evidence_quote: one (1) male dead body (about thirty years old) has been found in the river of Evros, close to the Greek bank

records.location_details: Dead body found in Loutra area, Feres, Evros, Greece.
records.context_note: Dead body found. On 13-05-2020 at 12:00 HP Officers of Alexandroupolis' Police Station were informed by passing person, who was moving close to Loutra area that a dead body (male) has been found in the area. No travel documents have been found. Dead body has been transferred to Alexandroupolis' Hospital. The autopsy has been requested by Hellenic Police in order to identify the reason of death. The results of the autopsy will be available in the follow-up SIR. The authopsy showed no criminal activity caused the migrant death.
records.evidence_quote: a dead body (male) has been found in the area. No travel documents have been found.

records.location_details: Shooting case in Evros, Greece, with shots heard from the Turkish side.
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location within Evros is redacted.
records.context_note: Shooting case. 13.05.2020 during daily text removed - justification 3 meeting text removed - justification 2 informed about 4 (four) shots heard on 12.05.2020 at 23:30 from the Turkish side. No Turkish Land Forces were observed nor other persons. According to Greek authority it is hardly to assess where the shots were fired from. The incident was also reported in shift report by text removed - justification 2 who were in that area (below), however the text removed - justification 2 was not directly affected - just heard the shots sound. Nobody was injured. No more information as regards to the incident will provided by Greek authority.
records.evidence_quote: 4 (four) shots heard on 12.05.2020 at 23:30 from the Turkish side.

records.location_details: Frontex staff member transported to Alexandroupolis hospital with severe bellyache, diagnosed with possible appendicitis/COVID.
records.context_note: Text removed - justification 2 in hospital with bellyache. 12.05.2020 at 16:50 the information came from text removed - justification 2 regarding to text removed - justification 2 deployed under RBI 2020 Evros who was transported by his ROU colleague to Alexandroupolis hospital, having sevre bellyache. Similar symptoms text removed - justification 2 had have last Sunday and after the doctor visit he had got paracetamol and come to the hotel. This time after an initial examination it was diagnosed like appendicitis. However due to the fact text removed - justification had 37,8 fever so they treated him as possible COVID case. It is normal hospital procedure in such cases. Despite of no other symptoms possibly associated with COVID were recognized, text removed - justification 2 were located in a separated part of the hospital. He will stay in the hospital this night for detailed medical checks. Tomorrow the test result for COVID will come out. Text removed - justification 2 is supposed to fully recover and be ready to resume operational activity in the end of Mayl/beginning of June.
records.evidence_quote: text removed - justification 2 deployed under RBI 2020 Evros who was transported by his ROU colleague to Alexandroupolis hospital, having sevre bellyache.

records.location_details: Two new shooting incidents in Evros, Greece, with gunshots from Turkish side.
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location within Evros is redacted.
records.context_note: Shooting cases. On 06.05.2020, at 19:40 hours approximately, text removed - justification 2 contacted with text removed - justification 2 to inform him about two new shooting incidents in Text removed - justification 4, in the same location where shooting incident took place a few days ago: 1- 14:40 hours, 2 gunshots, from a Turkish Text removed - justification 2 with three persons on board. 2- 14:45 hours, 4 gunshots, from another Turkish Text removed - justification 2 with six persons on board. Both incidents are reported by GRC Army and most probably caused by Turkish Gendarmerie. NO text removed - justification 2 involved in the cases. Nobody was injured. No more information as regards to the incident will provided by Greek authority.
records.evidence_quote: two new shooting incidents in Text removed - justification 4, in the same location where shooting incident took place a few days ago

records.location_details: Dead body found in Kotronia area, Soufli, Evros, Greece.
records.context_note: Dead body found. On 06-05-2020 at 17:15 HP Officers of Soufli Police Station were informed by a person, that a dead body (male), aged between 30-35 has been found in Kotronia area. No travel documents have been found. Dead body has been transferred to Alexandroupolis' Hospital. The autopsy has been requested by Hellenic Police in order to identify the reason of death. The results of the autopsy will be available in the follow-up SIR. On 15.05.2020 according information provided by text removed - justification 2 the deceased was a migrant (nationality unknown) and the autopsy excluded any criminal activity that may have caused the death of the person.
records.evidence_quote: a dead body (male), aged between 30-35 has been found in Kotronia area.

records.location_details: Shooting incident at Evros river, Greece, reported by HP Officer patrolling close to the river.
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location within Evros is redacted.
records.context_note: Shooting incident at Evros river. On the 28th of April at 19.45 HP Officer of Text removed - justification 4 while patrolling with text removed - justification 2 close to Evros river reported a shooting incident by Turkish Gendarmerie patrol that was patrolling in a close distance at the Turkish bank of the river. There were another mixed patrol of HP and Greek Army that was performing its tasks in a close distance of the incident. At 19:30 text removed - justification 2 heard a gunshot from the opposite side of the river. It was not possible to indentify to whom, in which direction the gunshot was. Text removed - justification 2 hided immediatelly and started to observe using text removed - justification 6. Then he saw a Turkish soldier (location: landing stage - Turkish camp - other riverside) with an assault rifle aiming in their direction. After a few seconds Turkish soldier took the weapon down and showed his right middle finger. Then he turned around and walked back into a tent. Other Turkish soldier was shouting: geliyor geliyor" (come, come). A third soldier observed them with binoculars. At 19:35 hours, on the one hand, a Turkish Text -removed justification 4, with six soldiers on board, arrived at the landing stage, while, on the other hand and at the same time, other boat, with three Turkish soldiers on board was abandoning the spot. The oservation was confirmed by text removed - justification 2 who also used text removed - justification 6. HP LO immediately informed his superior in Text removed - justification 4 about the incident. They all stayed in the area until the tension was de escalated. After that hey returned to the patrol car and finished their shift according to schedule. Patrol was performed in the vicinity of Text removed - justification 4. Nobody has been injured. HP Text removed - justification 2 informed immediately the superiors about the incident and text removed - justification 2 sent the info to text removed - justification 2. The patrol did not provoke Turkish Gendarmerie and stayed in the area until the tension stopped and then continued their patrol. It looked as it was a provocative action towards Greek and FX patrols. An alert note was distributed to the text removed - justification 2 for their awareness. The recommendation is to avoid any visible and verbal provocation with Turkish. Text removed - justification 2 strongly recommended to always wear text removed - justification 6 while patroling close to the border line. Whenever such a situation occurs text removed - justification 2 should report to HP Text removed - justification 2 and safety leave the area.
records.evidence_quote: HP Officer of Text removed - justification 4 while patrolling with text removed - justification 2 close to Evros river reported a shooting incident by Turkish Gendarmerie patrol
